item.title: An enjoyable and fruitful #OpenPGP email 2024 summit closing up .... with many standardization efforts roughly agreed between several players: maximizing metadata protection (IETF header protection effort), ecosystem transition V4->V6 and PQ-keys (IETF replacement keys), #autocrypt level 2 possibly involving integration of "in-band" with "out of band" key distribution like WKD/HKP which themselves are bound for integration. Believe it or not .... the eco system is moving ;) Flip chart with a rough list of in-band and out-of-band mechanisms and their properties .... Which served as a basis for "replacement key" and "key migration" use cases. Screenshot of toot at https://social.heise.de/@syt/112579950084148138Projector screenshot of header protection session presented and facilitated by dkg (not pictured)

The #EUGoingDark 42-point plan for after the election has it all: breaking e2e encryption, "lawful" data retention, prohibiting encrypting metadata, threatening jail to developers for non compliance ..... If we thought authoritarian political currents are moving against privacy then this is an entirely new level ... https://www.patrick-breyer.de/en/first-insight-42-key-points-of-the-secret-eugoingdark-surveillance-plan-for-the-new-eu-commission/ P.s. we need more #chatmail servers and contributors so that our #deltachat app-dev conglomerate provides resilience against such authoritarian pipe dreams

Before you ask: communities are massive multi-device setups. Delta's multi device setup is one of the most robust in the messenger industry. Turns out you can do multi device setups across different people's devices and #chatmail servers are fine with it. Because why not? Never before did a massive feature like "communities" arrive virtually overnight .... And unlike matrix spaces and discord communities they can be addressed and are not just closed circles where you need to join first.

News from our direct action R&D #deltalab : Addressable communities. End to end encrypted. No state on servers. Attached: first a chat from deltafans with the hispanohablantes community ... where someone from the Spanish side invites deltafans folks to join it. Second is the Spanish community chatlist where lots of chatting is going on ... Also includes the chat with the deltafans community. Both are independently running and can adress/ be adressed with a messenger UX you already know. A chat from the "deltafans" community with the hispanohablantes community (Spanish speaking ) community .... With an invitation to join it .... All members of both communitirs use guaranteed end to end encryption as the chat has a green checkmark. A chat list of the Spanish speaking community .... It has its own (Spanish speaking) topics and also a chat with "deltafans"

oopsie! We forgot to mention what is also new with the rolling android 1.46 release: on android you can react with any emoji now. In some real family chats this is more appreciated than all the other news :) Part of a message bubble.wirh two reactions, a heart and a party emoticon

It's a crazy property of #chatmail that it practically has zero state: if a Chatmail server is raided, burns to the ground etc but you still have DNS control, you just set it up somewhere and people can continue chatting. In that sense it's really like a router .... You can turn it off, wipe state, reinstall and turn it on. Theoretically someone might take your address if they arrive first with their login but they would not get readable message content so it would be more annoying than unsafe

How to get somewhat sufficient funding remains a question, however economic our approach is. We avoided VC funding and rather went for public tax-based funds because our efforts are driven by what we consider to be in the public interest. It is said that humanity can be morally.judged by how well those are doing who are living through the worst. We often focus on users in imminently dangerous situations but this is not where you can or want to earn money from, let alone surplus.

Delta Chat has "use but minimize" in its DNA when engaging with specs and standards. Autocrypt and #securejoin for guaranteed e2ee, #Chatmail servers with secure chat focus, #webxdc apps with html/css focus .... are the strategic examples of engaging with real internet standards but carefully curating the subset to go for .... Almost all standards are way too complex and unfitting for real world issues ... Our approach is neccessarily pragmatic because we lack resources to be idealism driven

A major milestone in our 6+ years long project history: With the rolling 1.46 #deltachat app releases you can start chatting without a pre-existing e-mail address, and benefit from push notifications (instant message delivery) also on Android. We also highlight ways to get in contact with bots and humans, and how #chatmail makes e-mail cheap again https://delta.chat/en/2024-05-31-instant-onboarding

Sounds like a bad joke but the EU governing council wants to once again legislate #chatcontrol for it's 350 million citizens. According to @echo_pbreyer (EU parlamentarian) the legislation wants to force messengers to prevent users from sending images or videos unless they agree them to be scanned, AI-analyzed and potentially reported to police. They apparently want to bring it up for a council vote in June and then negotiate it into a legally binding procedure in the EU https://www.patrick-breyer.de/en/let-yourself-be-monitored-eu-governments-to-agree-on-chat-control-with-user-consent/

A well running de-googled Android system based on and running #FOSS apps? Some are skeptical about Android fundamentally, others point to the existing mass of compatible devices that could participate. Of course Chromium alone makes "de-googling" a tricky effort, as its dependencies on Google run deep. Nevertheless, we are part of the #mobifree effort officially launched today and discussed here from project partners like @microg @NGIZero @daniel @guardianproject https://fosstodon.org/@microg/112480382433515629

While we do have criticisms of its centralized architecture and other choices we highly regard Signal for ushering in a decade of popularizing end-to-end encryption. We particularly appreciate @Mer__edith doing excellent communication work there. It's disingenuous that tech-billionaires Musk/Dorsey fuel attacks on her and another female colleague, hinting at Telegram as a more secure messenger. Comparing security of Signal with Telegram simply results in "Type Error: incompatible arguments".

WhatsApp introduces "ask meta ai" in the local chat search bar, and Slack auto-feeds messages to train their LLM robots https://eigenmagic.net/@NewtonMark/112455578857917485 ... Delta Chat is among the shrinking number of messaging applications that does not look at your data except to end-to-end encrypt it and send it over interoperable message transport servers chosen by yourselves and your contacts. #decentralization #security #privacy ftw!

The surprising developments in our teams happen "in between" when someone makes an "argument in code" after some inspirational chatting with others, often in cross project and cross-concern manners. Chaotic some might say, not unfittingly. Challenge is to sync it with our release scheduling and reliability discipline. There is this nice saying "you have to become disciplined to be undisciplined" which mirrors practises of how larger #ccc events are arranged in which delta chat grew up :)

#DeltaTouch, the native #UbuntuTouch version of delta chat just announced they are going for full webxdc app support in the summer .... There also is an experimental way to run it on #nixos to get a desktop that is not based on Elektron. Shout-out to @lk108 who is heading this great work even if it's "niche" for now .... DeltaTouch is pretty close to mainline features and arguably the best messenger on that os! https://social.tchncs.de/@deltatouch/112446568813809144

Often overlooked from our "but e-mail!" skeptics: Any sufficiently advanced P2P messenger will eventually re-invent a custom, partial form of e-mail ... because users want to communicate when their apps are offline or not foregrounded and active at the same time. See https://briarproject.org/download-briar-mailbox/ for a recent example. Delta Chat goes the reverse route by providing a secure and interoperable e-mail based messaging experience and then adds P2P tech like https://webxdc.org on top.

Just to be clear: we value our time and will not engage deeply with people who have a lot of random suggestions and ideas... We don't have a lack of those on any day :) we are doing continuous user studies, interviews and research with people in repressive, dangerous situations who are using delta chat today. These efforts are usually lead by @Xeniax and entail some scientific rigor as you can expect from a venerable PhD in user research :)

So far, our marketing department is mostly our development coordination department ... And it shows, right ? :) Indeed, we are marketing for early adopters, devs and collaborating experts in neighboring fields and projects to join what we believe is a unique collaborative effort, a fediverse of interactive messengers if you will :) Our project evolves around who shows up, who thinks and does things with us, not on some ideal conception of how things should be and then trying to hire for that.

Delta Chat may be criticized for not being the most secure messenger in some sense or not the most feature rich. When it comes to interoperability, however, our efforts and collaborations are the biggest game in town, no? The two biggest sets of internet standards revolve and operate at massive scale around E-Mail and the Web. Our approach fully engages and takes up these extremely impactful sets of standards, and reliably rewires them into a modern UI #deltachat #webxdc #chatmail #xkcd927

A quick note as a friendly project follower/user told us they perceived our toot to diminish Signal -- that's not our intention. Signal has Post-quantum safe algorithms, PFS, Sealed sender -- some pretty advanced mechanisms that have no Delta equivalent. However, Signal's key distribution is centralized and ours is decentralized which we consider fair game to highlight. Moreover DC has guaranteed e2ee encryption protecting from server compromise, allowing to not overly have to trust server ops.
